info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 20 at 6:40PM CDT until April 21 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in south central Missouri, Howell and Texas. In southwest Missouri, Greene, Webster and Wright.
* WHEN...Until 100 AM CDT Monday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 640 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Big Piney River at Cleveland Road, Beaver Creek at Crewes Ford Road, James River at Bell Ford Road, Howell Creek at County Road 9790, Elk Creek at Highway Z, South Fork Jacks Fork River at Stillhouse Road and Middle Fork Eleven Point River at County Road 1420. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Plains, Marshfield, Mountain Grove, Mountain View, Willow Springs, Houston, Licking, Rogersville, Cabool, Seymour, Mansfield, Fordland, Norwood, Hartville, Summersville, Niangua, Raymondville, Diggins, Dawson, Pomona, Duncan, South Fork, Brandsville, Huggins, Plato, Bendavis, Graff, Simmons, Elk Creek, Solo, Bucyrus, Manes, Success, Clear Springs, Roby, Yukon, Siloam Springs, Prescott, Hazelton and Odin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT MONDAY

area.areaDesc: Greene, MO; Howell, MO; Texas, MO; Webster, MO; Wright, MO
